column4: does anyone know of a good WiFi connection manager?  I've tried WiFi radar, and it sucks
network-manager-gnome
I've tried that, and it's even worse.  it dosn't show the WiFi networks in range, and it sucks for connecting.
I've had that problem before, to fix it I edited /etc/network/interfaces and commented out everything except the lo interface. then restarted the computer and it seemed to work then
well, now, I can't even get my internal WiFi card to work.  it won't connect to ANYTHING!!!!  I've got to run on a 802.11B card and it's slow as hell
hmm, what kind of wireless card is it?
it's an Athoes card.  It worked before, but the system will lock up occasionaly, then for the next few reboots, it won't work.
make sure restrited modules is installed for your kernel
in the reposeritys?
yup, in synaptic search for restricted modules and make sure that you have the one for your kernel installed, that *should* take care of it, if not I'm not quite sure than
ok, I'll have a quick look
it looks like they're installed
does the computer recognize your wireless card?
yes it does.  I can see it in iwconfig
but it won't show any wireless networks available?
well, if I type in the knowen network SSID, it won't connect to it.
any other ideas?
have you tried iwlist?
yes
did that show anything?
yes, it shows the list of SSIDs.
does the wireless network you are trying to connect to have WPA security on it?
nope, totaly open network.  I tried it first with encryption, then I rolled it back to test it.
have you tried configuring it in network-admin?
